subject: Nutrition
title: Fortification Saves Millions
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Fortification Saves Millions.

hook.text: Adding a fraction of a cent of nutrients to staple foods has prevented more disease than most drugs.

buildup.text: Iodized salt, fortified flour, and vitamin D milk became public health tools in the early 20th century.

discovery.text: Folic acid fortification cut neural tube birth defects by 25 to 50% in countries that adopted it.

twist.text: Some countries still resist fortification due to cost or ideologyâ€”and deficiency diseases persist there.

climax.text: Fortification proves that nutrition policy works when science, not industry, drives the decisions.

punchline.text: Pennies of prevention save billions in disease.

quiz.question: By how much did folic acid fortification reduce birth defects?
